distribution: Native to northern South America in Colombia, Venezuela, Guyana, Suriname, French Guiana and Brazil. Introduced populations exist in various countries, including Singapore and the USA.
habitat: Native to northern South America in Colombia, Venezuela, Guyana, Suriname, French Guiana and Brazil. Introduced populations exist in various countries, including Singapore and the USA.
maintenance: This species requires a lot of swimming space, so it is a good idea to furnish the tank fairly sparsely. Large pieces of bogwood and robust plants are recommended. These are large messy fish and require filtration that is up to the job. External or sump filtration should be considered.
diet: Piscivorous in nature. The diet should consist of meaty foods such as prawn, mussel, lancefish, whitebait and other white fish.
behaviour: Territorial and moderately aggressive. Can be kept in species groups or with other large species such as arowana, stingrays, large cats and other large cichlids. An extremely large tank is required to achieve this with any degree of success.
Will eat tankmates small enough to be considered food.
reproduction: Limited reports of breeding in the hobby.
